message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CR

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the problem of opinion spam detection in social media, which involves analyzing and understanding natural language text. Additionally, the paper proposes a deep learning model to automatically learn the semantics of reviews from user and product level information, which is a common approach in the field of natural language processing. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it involves analyzing and classifying textual data to identify spam reviews, which is a common task in information retrieval. 

Furthermore, the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a deep learning model to learn review representations from user and product level information. 

The paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with the problem of opinion spam in social media, which involves analyzing and understanding the relationships between users, products, and reviews. 

Finally, the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it deals with the problem of deceptive reviews, which can mislead consumers and have security implications for online marketplaces.
